meanings.definition: A thermodynamic quantity equivalent to the total heat content of a system.
meanings.sent1: The enthalpy of a substance tells us how much heat it contains.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use enthalpy to understand the energy within a system.
meanings.sent3: When the enthalpy of ice cream decreases, it melts faster.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project was like the enthalpy of a boiling pot.
meanings.sent5: The enthalpy of a volcano can be truly explosive.

meanings.definition: The heat content of a system at constant pressure.
meanings.sent1: At constant pressure, enthalpy helps us measure the heat in a system.
meanings.sent2: The enthalpy of a gas changes when it expands under constant pressure.
meanings.sent3: The enthalpy of a balloon animal is quite low.
meanings.sent4: His excitement rose like the enthalpy of a closed container under heat.
meanings.sent5: The enthalpy of a cup of tea can warm you up on a cold day.
